title: autumnleaf
author: autumnleaf
content: Hi guys, a friend of mine suggested this forum to me to learn more about crypto especially Bitcoin though i registered last March, I only started opening this thread. Can you spare a time to place a good links in this forum where I can learn a lot? There are really a lot of posted topics here and I really don't have an idea where should I start. I want to learn. Thanks everyone!

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: This makes a good intro.- https://learnmeabitcoin.com/If you like reading books- https://aantonop.com/books/iom/If you prefer watching videos- https://youtube.com/c/aantonopIndex website/ threads that comes in various aspect of bitcoin if you really want to dig the rabbit hole!- https://www.lopp.net/- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4928968.0I know it's a lot of resources that's why I recommend you to read until it becomes a habit.

comments.author: autumnleaf
comments.body: Appreciate your time sir, i'll bookmark the links you provided it's really worth a read. Thanks

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Take your precious time in absorbing all these information as it can be overwhelming. It personally took me a while to finally grasp bitcoin's value proposition.* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chapters

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: other members have shared links that you might want/need to read, but if you want to familiarize yourself with the forum I suggest reading these threads Newbies - Read before posting and Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ, reading these threads is a great way to start your journey here in the forum it could also help you avoid doing things that could get your account in trouble.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Check this out, there are a lot of curated threads across many subjects about cryptocurrencies:Beginners & Help Encyclopedia [UPD: +Electrum Board]

comments.author: autumnleaf
comments.body: Thank you for sharing the links, i'll make it sure to give time to read them, for now i think i must familiarize with the forum rules first as basis to help me grow in the course of my journey in this forum. Appreciate your help. Thanks

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: autumnleaf on July 25, 2022, 08:47:30 AM<snip>I'll be keeping a mental note of your account and how much you progress on the forum.You have a great mindset about the forum, and have shown qualities that many newbies lack, in the single thread.I'm not a merit source and don't always have stored smerits, so don't get excited. Quote from: autumnleaf on July 25, 2022, 03:16:59 AMThere are really a lot of posted topics here and I really don't have an idea where should I start. I want to learn. Thanks everyone!It can be overwhelming sometimes, so just take it a step at a time.Get understanding of the forum, and then the basics of cryptocurrencies.You can then use your basic knowledge as a directory to search for what topics interests you.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Hola, welcome. You'd love it here if you keep to the rules. One of the suggestions I like to give to newbies to go to this thread- Report plagiarism (copy/paste) here. Mods: please give temp or permban as needed and read thoroughly. One of the reasons is because very soon there will be subtle pressure to get merits and rank up ASAP. And this often leads newbies to flout the forum rules. Plagiarism is one of the "deadliest sins". Beware and be aware. Please, always, always reference any idea which you post that is not originally yours.
